intro: Bellevalia romana, commonly known as the Roman bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It features a basal rosette of narrow, linear leaves and produces showy blue or violet bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is part of the Campanulaceae family, which includes other flowering plants with similar floral structures. Bellevalia romana is often found in alpine and coastal environments, demonstrating its adaptability to harsh conditions.
